thread.title: The Grammar School holds a Fun Run
thread.title_full: The Grammar School holds a Fun Run

author: Brattleboro Reformer
title: The Grammar School holds a Fun Run
text:
The Grammar School holds a Fun Run Brattleboro Reformer Posted: 10/22/2015 11:35:19 PM EDT Updated: 10/22/2015 11:35:20 PM EDT Click photo to enlarge Beau Guenther, a sixth grader at The Grammar School in Putney, won the one-mile race in 6:15 during the fifth annual Fun Run at Green Mountain Orchards. « 1 » 
PUTNEY >> The Grammar School held its fifth annual Fun Run recently at Green Mountain Orchards. Eighty-four runners from Academy, BAMS, Putney Central, Ludlow, and The Grammar School ran a loop through the blueberry bushes and apple trees on a beautiful sunny afternoon at the height of fall foliage. 
In the individual half-mile race, Elan Dell of The Grammar School won in 3:36, followed by Ludlow runners Eli Boxer and Milo Tucker, both in 3:39. Carmen Whitney from Academy was the first girl and fourth overall in 3:40, Alexis Martin from Ludlow was second in 3:53, and Mia Koponen from Ludlow was the third girl in 4:01. 
The mile race was won by TGS sixth grader Beau Guenther in 6:15, a few seconds ahead of the first girl and second place overall finisher Ava Whitney from Academy in 6:22. Sam Hill from Academy was the second boy in 6:28, and Kyran Dell from TGS was the third place boy in 7:19. Second place girl was Amelia Austin from Academy in 7:36, and third place girl was Dorian Paquette from Academy in 7:44. 
Nolan Holmes from BAMS won the mile-and-a-half race in 9:34, followed by Putney Central runner Darius Parker in 9:49 and TGS third place finisher Gunnar Caldwell in 9:51. Rounding out the top four was first place girl Amelia Opsahl in 9:54. BAMS runners Alexandra Miskovich and Bella Takacs were the second and third girls in 11:02 and 11:38 respectively. Advertisement 
TGS Invitational team meet will be held Wednesday, Oct. 28 at The Grammar School. Teams need three runners per distance and gender to score, but individual runners are welcome, as well. The course walk will begin at 3:30 p.m.
